title: 820-01041-A not turning on
820-01041-A not turning on
message:
Machine is not recognized in DFU?
Check if all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present.

title: 820-01041-A not turning on
message:
Do not.
       The cable is new, I restored other machines with corrupted T2 using this cable.
Cable link I use: [URL]https://www.apple.com/shop/product/MWP32AM/A/thunderbolt-3-pro-cable-2-m[/URL]

Voltages:
PP3V3_AWAKE 0V is oscillating.
PP1V2_AWAKE 200mV is oscillating.
PP1V8_AWAKE 60mV is oscillating.
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE 50mV is oscillating.
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE 70mV is oscillating.
PP0V8_SLPS2R 60mV is oscillating.
PP1V8_SLPS2R 74mV is oscillating.
PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF 145mV, is oscillating.
PP1V1_SLPS2R 107mV is oscillating.

title: 820-01041-A not turning on
message:
You cannot put the machine in DFU mode, if these voltages are missing.
T2 is not even powered in such case.
Check diode mode on all these rails; compare with a good board.

title: 820-01041-A not turning on
message:
Diode scale:
PP3V3_AWAKE 0.643
PP1V2_AWAKE 0.533
PP1V8_AWAKE 0.354
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE 0.024
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE 0.475
PP0V8_SLPS2R 0.186
PP1V8_SLPS2R 0.001
PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF 0.682
PP1V1_SLPS2R 0.272

By the measurements, this mesh is with low resistance PP1V8_SLPS2R.

title: 820-01041-A not turning on
message:
"PP1V8_SLPS2R 0.001"
This is short for sure.

Lift L/R7813 and check where the short remains.

title: 820-01041-A not turning on
message: The short was in C7843, replaced, solved. Thanks!
